alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; North Cass; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin; South Cass; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued January 10 at 11:27AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...The Minnesota Pollution Control Agency has issued an Air Quality Alert for fine particle pollution. The Air Quality Index (AQI) is expected to reach the Orange or Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups category. * WHERE...Northeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Through 6 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, may experience health effects. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light winds combining with moisture from melting snow will trap fine particulate pollution near the surface in central and northwestern Minnesota. Air quality will improve Wednesday with the arrival of a cold front which will allow the fine particle pollution to disperse. For information on current air quality conditions in your area and to sign up for daily air quality forecasts and alert notifications by email, text message, phone, or the Minnesota Air mobile app, visit https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/current-air-quality. You can find additional information about health and air quality at https://www.pca.state.mn.us/air/why-you-should-care-air-quality-and- health.
info.instruction: Sensitive groups, such as people with lung disease (including asthma), heart disease, and children and older adults, should limit prolonged or heavy exertion.
